columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the current value; if six years from now, we receive $4,400 each year with a discount rate of 8.3%, and the last payment is 20 years from now.

We will consider the following details from the problem in solving the exercise.

| Particulars      |        |
|------------------|--------|
| Constant payment | $4,400 |
| Rate             | 8.3%   |
| Period (years)   | 15     |

Since the payment starts six years from now and ends twenty years from now, the duration of the payment period is fifteen years. Hence, the period is fifteen years.

To determine the value today of future payments that start six years from now, we will first calculate the present value of the annuity. The present value annuity calculates the current value of the annuity based on the discount rate, the period, and the constant payment received.

The present value annuity can be calculated using the following equation.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount or constant payment\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

Since the payment starts six years from now, the present value of the annuity is also based on six. To determine the present value today of the future payments, calculate the present value by discounting the value for five years, considering the present value of the annuity as the future value.

We will use the following details in calculating the present value of the annuity today:

| Particulars    |            |
|----------------|------------|
| Future value   | $36,981.52 |
| Rate           | 8.3%       |
| Period (years) | 5          |

The present value refers to the value today of the future amount, by multiplying the future value by the factor of the rate and period. The formula of the present value is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value} &=\dfrac{{FV}_{t}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate
To conclude, based on our calculation, the value of the annuity six years from now is $36,981.52, and the value today of the future payment discounting it five years is $24,822.33.
